Finding aid revised by Kelly Haydon and John Zarrillo to include digitized audio recordings
New York University Archives
Jeffrey Leeds Collection on NYU Glee Club
Leeds, Jeffrey
MC.265
1.5 Linear Feet in 1 manuscript box and 1 oversize flat box
1936-2000 1964-1968 Jeffrey Leeds is an actor, producer, and alumnus of New York University with a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology and Master of Science in Public Administration. He was a member of the NYU Glee Club and the original Vice President of the NYU Choral Arts Alumni Club. The Jeffrey Leeds Papers (dated 1936-2000) consist of materials created and collected by Jeffrey Leeds documenting his participation in the New York University Glee Club and other aspects of the university's musical organizations. Materials include performance programs, audio recordings, photographs, and other ephemera. The collection also includes Leeds' Glee Club blazer. Materials are in English.
Conditions Governing Access
Open for use without restrictions. This collection contains audiovisual materials that have not been digitized. Please contact the University Archives if you wish to access these materials.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Jeffrey Leeds in July 2016; the accession number associated with this gift is 2016.026.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Biographical / Historical
Jeffrey Leeds is an actor and producer, and as of 2016 is the President of the All Out Arts Board of Directors. Leeds is an alumnus of New York University with a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology and Master of Science in Public Administration. He was a member of the NYU Glee Club and the original Vice President of the NYU Choral Arts Alumni Club.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Jeffrey Leeds Collection on NYU Glee Club; MC 265; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning materials were placed in acid-free folders and boxes, and described on the collection- and item-level. No other arrangement or physical interventions have taken place.
The collection's audio recordings have been digitized.
Content Description
The Jeffrey Leeds Papers (dated 1936-2000) consist of materials created and collected by Jeffrey Leeds documenting his participation in the New York University Glee Club and other aspects of the university's musical organizations. Materials include performance programs, audio recordings, photographs, and other ephemera. The collection also includes Leeds' Glee Club blazer and 11 photographs taken by Arthur Smithline documenting student musical group activities in the 1930s.
Conditions Governing Use
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the: New York University Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2646
E-mail: university-archives@nyu.edu
Custodial History
Photographs taken by Arthur Smithline were donated to E. Jon Revere by Suzanne Smithline Manion, Smithline's daughter, and her husband Glenn Manion. Revere, a former conductor of the NYU Glee Club, later gave the photographs to Jeffrey Leeds to be added to his collection.
